general: This law allows the government to spend money from April 2020 until March 2021, using funds from the country's main budget called "Consolidated Fund". It also lets them borrow more money if needed during these months too! This means they can pay bills like salaries or buy things necessary without worrying about running low on cash before next years fund comes through again - all while keeping track so nothing goes wrong financially speaking...

series.short: "UK Budget Boosts Healthcare and Education Spending by £813 Billion"
series.text: * Simplified Point 1: The Main Authorization for Use of Resources for 2020–21 increases resource authorization by $813 billion pounds sterling ($bn GBP.) This covers spending approved through parliament during fiscal years starting between January 1st, 2020 – December 31st., 2020 ("year ending" refers back here.). Of these funds allocated towards "Current Purposes," around half goes toward daycare services while another third gets directed towards health care initiatives such as cancer treatments/hospice support systems within England alone! Additionally funded projects include education reforms aimed specifically target student needs across all age ranges - infants' learning environments right upto university level studies so everyone can benefit somehow via improved educational infrastructure investments throughout Britain today."

summary: The Supply and Appropriation (Main Estimates) Act 2020 allows the government to spend £813 billion on various programs and services for the financial year ending March 31, 2021. This includes money for things like healthcare, education, and childcare. Half of the budget goes towards supporting current expenses, with most of that going towards providing affordable childcare options for families. Additionally, there is funding set aside for improving educational facilities at all levels, from infant schools up to universities, so that students have access to better learning environments.
single:
* The Supply and Appropriation (Main Estimates) Act 2020 authorizes the use of resources for the year ending March 31, 2021.
* The act appropriates £813,133,582,000 for the year ending March 31, 2021, of which £451,457,900,000 is for current purposes and £63,647,612,000 is for capital purposes.
* The act appropriates £448,030,352,000 for the issue of money out of the Consolidated Fund in the year ending March 31, 2021.
* The act appropriates resources for the year ending March 31, 2021, for current or capital purposes, for expenditure authorized by Parliament.
* The act authorizes the use of income arising for the year ending March 31, 2021, from matters specified in the Scheduled Estimates, for current or capital purposes.
* The act authorizes the Treasury to give directions for rectifying any contravention of the act.
* The act has effect from the beginning of April 2020.
